title: Alexa Chung looks chic in an embroidered shirt dress at Harper's Bazaar Women of The Year Awards
text:
Alexa Chung looked effortlessly chic as she attended the star-studded Harper's Bazaar Women of The Year Awards at Claridge's Hotel in London on Tuesday.

The model, 35, opted for an elegant white shirt dress with black embroidered detailing on it.

Alexa teamed the item of clothing with a pair of tights and a black belt which cinched in her svelte waist.

Chic: Alexa Chung looked effortlessly chic as she attended the star-studded Harper's Bazaar Women of The Year Awards at Claridge's Hotel in London on Tuesday

Earlier in the night, the fashionista layered her look with a grey tweed coat with black velvet lapels and six buttons.

Alexa added height to her model frame with a pair of black barely-there heeled sandals to complete her look.

The presenter styled her brunette locks into a glossy curly blow-dried hairdo, she added a slick of minimal make-up to enhance her pretty features.

Alexa led a slew of stars in attendance at the awards bash including Cate Blanchett, Helena Bonham-Carter and Rosie Huntington-Whiteley.

Elegant: The model, 35, opted for an elegant white shirt dress with black embroidered detailing on it

Details: Earlier in the night, the fashionista layered her look with a grey tweed coat with black velvet lapels and six buttons

The model's appearance comes after she was lauded by her fans for blasting a troll who criticised her slim figure earlier this month.

The 35-year-old star was quick to fire back with a simple yet effective retort when a fan left a cruel comment on one of her Instagram posts.

The fashion icon was sporting a 60s inspired shift dress with a short hemline and flared sleeves, her long legs taking centre stage in the image.

Work it: Alexa added height to her model frame with a pair of black barely-there heeled sandals to complete her look (pictured with actress Gala Gordon)

Signature look: The presenter styled her brunette locks into a glossy curly blow-dried hairdo, she added a slick of minimal make-up to enhance her pretty features (pictured with Gala and Greta Bellamacina)

Quick-witted retort: The model's appearance comes after she was lauded by her fans for blasting a troll who criticised her slim figure earlier this month

Commenting underneath the post, the troll wrote: 'In 2019, you still shamelessly demonstrate an obsolete sick, anorexic icon and a bunch of teen dimwits buy it... Just go home.'

Alexa replied: 'Speaking of obsolete trends, didn’t bullying people on social media get cancelled?'

The model turned designer's fans praised her for her quick-witted comeback, commenting 'YASSS' and 'she handled that perfectly!'

Commenting underneath the post, the troll wrote: 'In 2019, you still shamelessly demonstrate an obsolete sick, anorexic icon and a bunch of teen dimwits buy it... Just go home'

Others chimed in with statements defending Alexa, with one follower posting: 'Interesting that you think making unsolicited personal comments about someone else’s appearance, making assumptions about someone else’s life, then telling them to ‘go home’ isn’t bullying...'

Another fan wrote: 'U think she should stop showing herself just for having natural skinny, and healthy body? Plus she does not base her feed on a body image, just her style. Let her and her cleverness flow.'

Alexa previously revealed she was upset about people commenting on her weight online, saying: ‘I think it's about time people stopped judging women on their appearance and more on their intellect.

‘I think it's about time people stopped judging women': Alexa previously revealed she was upset about people commenting on her weight online (pictured in September)

She told Fashionista.com it ‘sucked’ that she had been dubbed a ‘thinspiration' - as she insisted she would like to gain 10 pounds.

She said: ‘How do you know I’m not looking in the mirror and going "I wish I could gain ten pounds?" Which is actually quite often the case.

‘But if you say that you sound like you’re bragging that you’re naturally thin, and you’re not allowed to do that because even though it’s not the ideal weight, it kind of is as well.’
